byline.contributor: Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

abstract: Islamist-backed faction in Libya's civil war says it has made its first airstrike, hitting opponents in town of Zintan; attack diminishes hopes for United Nations-sponsored mediation effort.
lead_paragraph: The Islamist-backed faction Libya Dawn said it had launched its first airstrike, targeting opponents in the town of Zintan in an escalation of the civil conflict.

headline.main: Islamist Faction in Libya Now Strikes From the Sky
headline.print_headline: Islamist Faction in Libya Now Strikes From the Sky

snippet: The Islamist-backed faction Libya Dawn said it had launched its first airstrike, targeting opponents in the town of Zintan in an escalation of the civil conflict.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
